events.description: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) maintained its key repo rate at 5.25% during its February 2026 meeting.

facts.fact_text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) maintained its key repo rate at 5.25% during its February 2026 meeting.

evidences.evidence_text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) maintained its key repo rate at 5.25% during its February 2026 meeting, the first monetary policy decision of the year, after cutting it by 25 bps at the December meeting, in line with forecasts, amid confidence in a softer inflation outlook and improving growth prospects.

facts.fact_text: India’s annual inflation accelerated to 1.33% in December 2025 but remained below the RBI’s tolerance band of 2%–6%.

evidences.evidence_text: India’s annual inflation accelerated to 1.33% in December 2025 but remained below the RBI’s tolerance band of 2%–6%, while GDP grew 8.2% in the September quarter.

facts.fact_text: GDP grew 8.2% in the September quarter.

evidences.evidence_text: India’s annual inflation accelerated to 1.33% in December 2025 but remained below the RBI’s tolerance band of 2%–6%, while GDP grew 8.2% in the September quarter.

facts.fact_text: The RBI raised its GDP growth forecast for FY2025/26 to 7.4%, up from its earlier estimate of 7.3%.

evidences.evidence_text: On the economic outlook, the RBI raised its GDP growth forecast for FY2025/26 to 7.4%, up from its earlier estimate of 7.3%.

facts.fact_text: GDP growth for H1 of FY27 was also revised upward, with growth projected at 6.9% in Q1 and 7.0% in Q2.

evidences.evidence_text: GDP growth for H1 of FY27 was also revised upward, with growth projected at 6.9% in Q1 and 7.0% in Q2.

facts.fact_text: Inflation for FY26 is projected at 2.1%.

evidences.evidence_text: Meanwhile, inflation for FY26 is projected at 2.1%.

facts.fact_text: The RBI also kept the SDF rate at 5.0% and the MSF rate at 5.50%.

evidences.evidence_text: The RBI also kept the SDF rate at 5.0% and the MSF rate at 5.50%.

evidence.evidence_text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) maintained its key repo rate at 5.25% during its February 2026 meeting
India’s annual inflation accelerated to 1.33% in December 2025
GDP grew 8.2% in the September quarter.
